definitions.def: A vector described with magnitude and angle.

secText: Vectors can be described with rectangular coordinates, (x, y), or in polar form, with magnitude and angle.
Vectors described with magnitude and angle are being expressed in the polar coordinate system.
We show a car with a displacement of 2.0 km. The length of the vector is proportional to its magnitude, as always.

The angle is the angle made with the positive x-axis, which is the usual way to describe an angle. Positive angles are measured in the counterclockwise direction. The angle in the upper diagram is 150°.
We show two examples of velocity vectors. The first is velocity of 5 m/s at 50°. Its length, 5 m/s, is its magnitude.
The second velocity vector is 8 m/s at 210°. The 210° is the angle made with the positive x-axis.
